dependencies.description: A Python library for arbitrary-precision floating-point arithmetic.
dependencies.name: py-mpmath

dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.
dependencies.name: py-pip

dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.
dependencies.name: py-setuptools

dependencies.description: A Spack managed Python virtual environment
dependencies.name: python-venv

dependent_to.description: Organelle Genome Assembly Toolkit (Chloroplast/Mitocondrial/ITS)
dependent_to.name: getorganelle

dependent_to.description:
NEURON is a simulation environment for single and networks of neurons.
NEURON is a simulation environment for modeling individual and networks
of neurons. NEURON models individual neurons via the use of sections
that are automatically subdivided into individual compartments, instead
of requiring the user to manually create compartments.
dependent_to.name: neuron

dependent_to.description: Advanced Multilanguage Interface for CVODES and IDAS
dependent_to.name: py-amici

dependent_to.description: The Brain Modeling Toolkit
dependent_to.name: py-bmtk

dependent_to.description: A clock-driven simulator for spiking neural networks
dependent_to.name: py-brian2

dependent_to.description:
DaCe is a fast parallel programming framework that takes code in
Python/NumPy and other programming languages, and maps it to high-
performance CPU, GPU, and FPGA programs, which can be optimized
programmatically or interactively.
dependent_to.name: py-dace

dependent_to.description:
Devito is a Python package to implement optimized stencil computation.
(e.g., finite differences, image processing, machine learning) from
high-level symbolic problem definitions. Devito builds on SymPy and
employs automated code generation and just-in-time compilation to
execute optimized computational kernels on several computer platforms,
including CPUs, GPUs, and clusters thereof.
dependent_to.name: py-devito

dependent_to.description: Next generation FEniCS Form Compiler
dependent_to.name: py-fenics-ffcx

dependent_to.description:
The FInite element Automatic Tabulator FIAT supports generation of
arbitrary order instances of the Lagrange elements on lines, triangles,
and tetrahedra. It is also capable of generating arbitrary order
instances of Jacobi-type quadrature rules on the same element shapes.
Further, H(div) and H(curl) conforming finite element spaces such as the
families of Raviart-Thomas, Brezzi-Douglas-Marini and Nedelec are
supported on triangles and tetrahedra. Upcoming versions will also
support Hermite and nonconforming elements
dependent_to.name: py-fenics-fiat

dependent_to.description:
Matminer is a library for performing data mining in the field of
materials science.
dependent_to.name: py-matminer

dependent_to.description:
NetworkX is a Python package for the creation, manipulation, and study
of the structure, dynamics, and functions of complex networks.
dependent_to.name: py-networkx

dependent_to.description:
ONNX Runtime is a performance-focused complete scoring engine for Open
Neural Network Exchange (ONNX) models, with an open extensible
architecture to continually address the latest developments in AI and
Deep Learning. ONNX Runtime stays up to date with the ONNX standard with
complete implementation of all ONNX operators, and supports all ONNX
releases (1.2+) with both future and backwards compatibility.
dependent_to.name: py-onnxruntime

dependent_to.description:
phydms enables phylogenetic analyses using deep mutational scanning data
to inform the substitution models. It implements Experimentally informed
codon models (ExpCM) for phylogenetic inference and the detection of
biologically interesting selection.
dependent_to.name: py-phydms

dependent_to.description:
A source-to-source Fortran compiler designed to programmatically
optimise, parallelise and instrument HPC applications (written in
Fortran) via user- provided transformation scripts. Additionally,
PSyclone supports the development of kernel-based, Fortran-embedded DSLs
and is used in the UK Met Office's next-generation modelling system,
LFRic.
dependent_to.name: py-psyclone

dependent_to.description:
Python Materials Genomics is a robust materials analysis code that
defines core object representations for structures and molecules with
support for many electronic structure codes. It is currently the core
analysis code powering the Materials Project.
dependent_to.name: py-pymatgen

dependent_to.description:
Pyomo is a Python-based open-source software package that supports a
diverse set of optimization capabilities for formulating and analyzing
optimization models.
dependent_to.name: py-pyomo

dependent_to.description:
Qiskit is an open-source SDK for working with quantum computers at the
level of extended quantum circuits, operators, and algorithms.
dependent_to.name: py-qiskit-terra

dependent_to.description:
Qsymm is a symmetry finder and symmetric Hamiltonian generator. It
automatically generates model Hamiltonians from symmetry constraints and
finds the full symmetry group of your Hamiltonian.
dependent_to.name: py-qsymm

dependent_to.description:
Blackbird is a quantum assembly language for continuous-variable quantum
computation, that can be used to program Xanadu’s quantum photonics
hardware and Strawberry Fields simulator.
dependent_to.name: py-quantum-blackbird

dependent_to.description:
SfePy (https://sfepy.org/) is a software for solving systems of coupled
partial differential equations (PDEs) by the finite element method in
1D, 2D and 3D. It can be viewed both as black-box PDE solver, and as a
Python package which can be used for building custom applications.
dependent_to.name: py-sfepy

dependent_to.description: Open source library for continuous-variable quantum computation
dependent_to.name: py-strawberryfields

dependent_to.description: Symbolic Fitting; fitting as it should be.
dependent_to.name: py-symfit

dependent_to.description:
A library for the calculation of hafnians, Hermite polynomials and
Gaussian boson sampling.
dependent_to.name: py-thewalrus

dependent_to.description:
Tensors and Dynamic neural networks in Python with strong GPU
acceleration.
dependent_to.name: py-torch

dependent_to.description: Import, export, process, analyze and view triangular meshes
dependent_to.name: py-trimesh

dependent_to.description: A package for handling numpy arrays with units.
dependent_to.name: py-unyt

description: SymPy is a Python library for symbolic mathematics.
name: py-sympy

variants.description: Build systems supported by the package
variants.name: build_system
